column1: Subacute combined degeneration is a disorder of the spine, brain, and nerves.
Subacute combined degeneration is caused by vitamin B12 deficiency.

People are at high risk for this condition if vitamin B12 cannot be absorbed from their intestine or if they have: - Pernicious anemia - Disorders of the small intestine, including Crohn disease - Problems absorbing nutrients, which can occur after gastrointestinal surgery
